Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Manual change of hash into the URL doesn't trigger the route in IE11" (#1849) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/Aymkdn/pen/MENZPx](https://codepen.io/Aymkdn/pen/MENZPx)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Use IE11 
2. Open codepen at https://codepen.io/Aymkdn/pen/MENZPx 
3. Click on "Open demo"
4. Click on "Go to foo" or click on "Go to bar" to see it works correctly
5. Manually change the hash into the URL from the IE11 address bar (for example replace "#/foo" with "#/bar")

### What is expected?
The component to be loaded based on the current hash into the URL

### What is actually happening?
The changes are not detected under IE11. It works with Firefox.

---
When the page is already opened and I want to copy/paste a link into the same page which has the same url but a different path/hash

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Vue.nextTick doesn't seem to work with Vuex" (#1023) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.5.0

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/n9jmu5v7/2421/](https://jsfiddle.net/n9jmu5v7/2421/)

### Steps to reproduce
Click the "Change" button.

### What is expected?
The value updates to "B" immediately, and then to "C" after a few seconds.

### What is actually happening?
The value stays at "A", and updates to "C" after a few seconds.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Suggestion to have store object as "this" in getters" (#1020) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Store getters don't have this parameter and link to store instance

### What does the proposed API look like?
Is it possible to add instance "store" as parameter to call function "rawGetter"? Or change to rawGetter.call(store, {...}) to have "this" parameter in getters functions?
https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/a8326b1bd77158e7e5903eed4cc98b52599e3dbd/src/store.js#L436-L442

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "getters are `undefined` in `data()`, but `this.$store.state` is not" (#1022) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.0

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/72284/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/72284/)

### Steps to reproduce
The jsfiddle link should illustrate this issue well

### What is expected?
test1, test2, test3 should be the same value

### What is actually happening?
test2 is undefined, which is set by getters in data()

### Other Comments
Vuex1 seem to have no such issue.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
